ygData.subject: Re: Crawling Images into ARC Files

Thanks.  My firewall seemed to be blocking images.  It's working now.

Now,=
 at the risk of blocking images again, if I want to crawl only *pages* on t=
he hosts in the seeds file, but to download any embedded images that are ho=
sted on other sites.

For example, if I were to crawl www.cnn.com, I would =
want all the images from cdn.turner.com, but I wouldn't want to crawl any p=
ages on cdn.turner.com (only www.cnn.com).

I was thinking about rejecting =
in a NotOnHostsDecideRule, but accepting if the content type matches "image=
/.*", but maybe there's a better way?

Thanks.

--- In archive-crawler@yaho=
ogroups.com, "steve@..." <steve@...> wrote:
>
> hi Scott,
> 
> you can insp=
ect the crawl log directly to see if images
> are being downloaded. and if =
you're using the web UI,
> you can look at the log reports.
>

e just crawled 100 URLs from "www.cnn.com" with
> Heritrix 1.14.3 and found=
 230 GIFs and 174 JPGs in the
> logs, most of which came from "cdn.turner.c=
om".
>

> *transclusion=
* of offsite inline images?
